how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, my TiddlyWiki is for personal use only
putting it all together, what value does: TW lets me organize and see my data in different ways. It helps me see connections between two disparate locations that I didn't see before and helps me articulate that connection beyond TW.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: My use is basic; I use TiddlyWiki in a configuration close to standard, without plugins
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I have a growing number of macros and even edited some of the core to create the sidebar that I wanted. It's constantly evolving though.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: I love the adapatability of it. I actually do like the Vanilla Color Scheme.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Multiple users. I know you were working on this. It's the biggest change that I would need. I would also love to see more "You have no idea what you're doing" tutorials that function on more of an as needed bases. GrokTW is ok, but it's too structured to get what I want out of it most of the time, like a class instead of a "You wanna do this, here's how" type of thing, and the TW site is more for those who already know what they are doing.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
